column1: Saint-Pol-sur-Mer (West Flemish: Sint-Pols) is a former commune in the Nord department in northern France.  Since 9 December 2010
column2: it is part of the commune of Dunkirk. In 2006 it had 22
column3: 354 inhabitants.  It is the second-largest suburb of the city of Dunkirk
column4: and is almost encircled by it.
